key_findings: DreamDance reformulates the character art animation task into two inpainting-based steps: Camera-aware Scene Inpainting for stable scene reconstruction and Pose-aware Video Inpainting for dynamic character animation.

Camera-aware Scene Inpainting leverages a pre-trained image inpainting model to generate multi-view images and construct a large-scale 3D Gaussian field from the reference character art, utilizing both a pre-defined spiral camera trajectory and an extracted custom camera trajectory.

A coarse background video is rendered along the custom trajectory by splatting the stable Gaussian field, providing consistent scene motion information as a foundation for the character animation stage.
Pose-aware Video Inpainting injects dynamic character animation into the coarse background video by inpainting the character regions with pose guidance from the driving video.

The two-stage inpainting approach produces consistent, high-quality animation sequences from the reference character art and driving videos, addressing the temporal jitter and scene distortion issues faced by previous 3D-agnostic methods.
main_contribution: DreamDance proposes a novel paradigm for animating in-the-wild character art by reformulating the task into two inpainting-based steps: Camera-aware Scene Inpainting for stable scene reconstruction...
problem_addressed: Animating in-the-wild character art with consistent scene context and without temporal jitter or scene distortion.
